title: Bollini 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: Aromas of pear and a light floral note lead the nose on this simple white. The lively, straightforward palate offers green apple and almond alongside bright acidity.

title: Brengman Brothers 2013 Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Bright red cherry is covered in a blanket of dusty spice on the nose of this pale ruby-colored Pinot Noir. There's a solid amount of tension to the light-bodied palate, with juicy red cherry and currant balanced by soft, sandy tannins.
designation: Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyard

title: Kudos 2014 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Tight and tannic, this single-vineyard offering emphasizes flavors of herb, grass and green leaf. There's a hint of pale, generic red fruit, but it's more in the veggie camp—think rhubarb rather than raspberry. A hint of brown sugar rounds out the finish.

title: Naia 2014 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Pungent, feline aromas of sweat and cactus set up a sharp, citric palate that's loaded to the brim with acidity. Austere flavors of passion fruit and lime end with a note of mango along with a wave of citric burn.

title: Schäfer 2014 Red Sheep Red (Rheinhessen)
description: Plush and supple, this is an easy-drinking blend of Dornfelder, Portugieser, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's a soft, juicy wine full of primary black cherry and berry flavors, without even a whisper of tannins, but enjoyable for uncomplicated, immediate consumption.

title: Segura Viudas NV Aria Brut Pinot Noir Sparkling (Cava)
description: This sweet-tasting brut Cava is based on Pinot Noir, and it's rusty salmon in color, with rustic aromas. Quite foamy on the palate, this lacks finesse. Flavors of citrus, pink grapefruit and pineapple finish toasty and mildly bitter, but also sugary and sweet.

title: Macchia 2013 Lodi Native Schmiedt Ranch Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: The ripest and strongest of the Lodi Native wines this year, this has raspberry and black pepper aromas tinged with dusty, earthy accents, and heavy flavors like stewed plums.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Red (Tejo)
description: This is a half-and-half blend of Touriga Nacional from northern Portugal and Castelão from the south. It's a wine that has plenty of fruit although the two grapes lie uneasily together. The juicy flavors and red berries are contrasted with a metallic acidity that isn't pleasant. Hopefully, the wine will fill out.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV Espumante Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: A lively mousse characterizes this fresh and fruity wine. It's light, frothy in flavor as well as texture, an attractive concoction of apples and pink grapefruit. The final taste brings out acidity.

title: Quinta da Lapa NV Reserva Bruto Nature Arinto (Tejo)
description: The natural acidity of Arinto is well known for sparkling wines in Bucelas close to Lisbon. Here it has the same fresh, crisp, tight character and vibrant texture. It's light, creamy and fruity, a fine apéritif style.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is ripe, soft and with attractive red berry fruits over acidity. Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon make a happy blend of fruit and gentle structure. Drink now.

title: Hanson Vineyards 2014 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: Slightly volatile aromas suggest bubble gum, and the fruit flavors continue in that vein. It does a quick fade into a dry, lightly mineral finish.

title: Laurentide 2013 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Pert and juicy in feel, overripe lemon and peach tones mark the nose and palate. This is enjoyable but not overly engaging or long lasting on the palate.

title: Ledger David 2013 Dark Night Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Principally Tempranillo, this blended red shows light berry fruit and stiff, earthy tannins. Aged 17 months in 17% new French oak, it doesn't quite come into balance, and finishes with chalky acids.

title: Cembra 2014 Müller-Thurgau (Trentino)
description: Simple but competently constructed, this opens with aromas of white spring flower and a hint of orchard fruit. The lively palate offers up white peach and a citrus note alongside bright acidity.

title: Borgo Conventi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This opens with aromas of white spring flower, pear and a whiff of adhesive bandage that all carry over to the raw palate along with unripe apple and a hint of lime. It's rather lean, with bracing acidity.

title: Cicchitti 2013 Vino Tinto Red (Mendoza)
description: Gritty aromas of asphalt, herbs, tomato and plum make for a tough opening. This is syrupy and grabby on the palate, with creamy berry and cooked brown-sugar flavors. A sinewy finish tastes medicinal and a touch weedy.

title: Conti Formentini 2014 Furlanà Friulano (Collio)
description: Aromas of chamomile flower and toasted nut waft out of the glass. The spare, rather diluted palate shows the cool, wet conditions that dominated 2014 while offering up yellow apple skin, mineral and brisk acidity but not much fruit richness.

title: Broken Earth 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Punchy peach, mango, guava and nearly bubblegum aromas make for a very ripe and tropical nose on this wine. It's easy to sip, like a lazy summer day, with coconut-oil flavors cut by lemon juice.

title: Campillo 2014 El Niño de Campillo  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of lacquer and wood grain are forceful and dominant. Not surprisingly, this feels resiny. Flavors of grainy wood outweigh raspberry notes, while the finish tastes mostly of minty oak.

title: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Malvasia (Collio)
description: The shy nose doesn't give much away except for a hint of beeswax. The lean palate shows suggestions of mineral and lime alongside bracing, almost crackling acidity.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Rosé (Tejo)
description: This blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot gives fresh red fruits that are crisp and sharp as a needle. The wine is lively and fruity, soft and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas

title: Wyncroft 2012 Avonlea Pinot Noir (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Medium ruby in color, this Pinot has an overripe bramble berry aroma, with a slightly stemmy quality in the background. The light-bodied palate boasts juicy red fruits, zippy acidity and sandy tannins.

title: Wyncroft 2013 Wren Song Ice Wine Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: The nose shows concentrated aromas of pineapple and peach juice that carry to the thick, rich palate. A bit cloying in nature, there isn't enough acidity to create balance come the honeyed-peach finish.

title: Tenuta Peter Sölva & Söhne 2014 I Vigneti Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Light scents of spring blossom and pear waft out of the glass. The simple palate is rather diluted and decidedly lean, showing hints of apple skin, mineral and brisk acidity.

title: Schmidt 2014 Riesling (Applegate Valley)
description: This is done in a soft, loose-knit, wide-open style—not the usual crisp and racy Riesling found in the Northwest. Apple and orange fruits are accented with notes of cracker and grain. It feels a bit flat in the finish. Drink up.

title: La Rajade 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This opens with subdued aromas that suggest chamomile flower, passion fruit and a whiff of adhesive bandage. The lean, stringy palate shows notes of crunchy celery, grapefruit and a hint of stone alongside nervous acidity.

title: Lagaria 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: Fun and fresh, this informal white offers whiffs of white flower and pear. The straightforward palate presents notes of apple and peach alongside lively acidity. It's not complex, but it is well made.

title: Pope Valley Winery 2012 One Hundred Percent Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Bittersweet and youthful, this wine is overburdened by tannin and a weightiness of oak. Blackberry and gunpowder showcase its 100% varietal devotion, before more oak presents itself on the finish.

title: Quinta da Foz 2014 Vinha da Foz Branco White (Douro)
description: A fresh, citrus-flavored wine that is all about fruitiness. It is light, bright and tangy with orange and lemon zest. It is floral, crisp and ready to drink.
